docs.snippet: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. Today, great reads from Matt Apuzzo, Prashant Rao and others.
docs.abstract: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. Today, great reads from Matt Apuzzo, Prashant Rao and others.

docs.snippet: Anthony Senecal admitted writing vulgar, racially tinged Facebook posts attacking the president, Hillary Clinton and others.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Trump Butler Makes Vulgar Anti-Obama Posts
headline.main: Donald Trump’s Former Butler Calls for Obama’s Death; Secret Service to Investigate

docs.abstract: Secret Service announces it will investigate Facebook posts written by Donald J Trump's former butler Anthony Senecal, in which he stated, using vulgar and racially-focused language, that Pres Obama should be hanged for treason.

docs.snippet: A 1989 Supreme Court decision continues to immunize government from the kind of accountability that common sense and justice would seem to require.

headline.print_headline: The Supreme Court and a Life Barely Lived
headline.main: The Supreme Court and a Life Barely Lived

docs.snippet: The bride is a manager at Facebook, and the groom a reporter for The New York Times.

headline.print_headline: Jessica Baker,  Michael de la Merced
headline.main: Jessica Baker, Michael de la Merced

docs.snippet: The app fits into Google’s playbook. Over the last few years, Google has increasingly offered its important software and internet services to iPhone customers.

headline.print_headline: Bridging the Android-Apple Divide, Face to Face
headline.main: Google Duo Makes Video Calling Between Operating Systems Easier

docs.abstract: Tech Fix column; Google introduces Duo, mobile video-calling app that is alternative to Apple's FaceTime, which lets users make video calls to Android and iPhone users.

docs.snippet: A key lesson from a data breach of Mark Zuckerberg’s social media accounts: Quit using the same password for multiple websites.

headline.main: If Mark Zuckerberg Can Be Hacked on Twitter, So Can You

docs.snippet: Uber is leaving China; fantasy sports are returning to New York; and, for better or worse, Facebook will control what headlines you see.

headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: Facebook’s Headline Rules

docs.snippet: A plethora of examples involving companies like Dell, Facebook and Tribune Publishing prove that shareholder votes can be of great consequence.
The European Commission’s newest charges add more time to the clock, a disadvantage in the ever-shifting tech market.

headline.main: Google’s Antitrust Charges in Europe Need Quick Action

docs.snippet: The sale of Yahoo’s core web business to Verizon for $4.83 billion caps a long downward spiral for the onetime pioneer, which at its height was valued at $125 billion.

headline.main: What Goes Up Must Come Down: The End of Yahoo as We Know It
